text: The Sonoma tiny home, designed by Spindrift Homes, serves as a sophisticated and lovely reimagining of compact living. Conceived as a towable residence for two, this 26-foot-long tiny house exudes a generosity of space not often found in its category. Priced at a compelling $110,000 and delivered fully furnished, the Sonoma blends affordability with a high standard of comfort and design. Its double-axle trailer base ensures mobility, while the exterior’s rich wood finish, metal roof, and expansive glazing offer both durability and warmth. A pair of wide, double glass doors welcomes you inside, blurring the boundary between indoors and out, and ushering in abundant natural light. Inside, the living area immediately impresses with its sense of openness. High ceilings amplify the volume of the room, while a large L-shaped sofa bed provides flexibility for lounging or accommodating guests. Skylights and generous windows flood the space with daylight, creating a bright, inviting atmosphere. Modern amenities are seamlessly integrated, including a mini-split air conditioning system and a surround-sound hi-fi setup, providing comfort and entertainment without compromise. Designer: Spindrift Homes The kitchen, directly adjoining the living area, is designed for both efficiency and pleasure. It boasts a three-burner propane cooktop, an oven, a retro-inspired fridge/freezer, and a generous sink, all set within a framework of substantial cabinetry and a pantry. A compact, collapsible dining table offers a dedicated spot for meals, then tucks away to free up floor space. Spindrift Homes has even managed to fit a washer/dryer into the mix, further enhancing the tiny home’s suitability for full-time living. Moving toward the rear of the Sonoma, the bathroom is surprisingly well-appointed. It includes a composting toilet, a sleek sink, and a shower, all complemented by extra storage options that help keep things organized and clutter-free. The sleeping quarters are accessed by a storage-integrated staircase, maximizing utility with every step. The loft bedroom, while featuring a characteristically low ceiling, is thoughtfully designed for coziness and comfort, housing a double bed and enjoying the light from a skylight overhead. Every detail of the Sonoma is engineered to elevate daily life, from the sweeping natural light to the smart storage solutions and the inviting, furnished interiors. It’s a home that embraces minimalism without ever feeling sparse, proving that even modest square footage can deliver a living experience that’s both refined and deeply satisfying. It is a shining example of how clever design, quality materials, and attention to detail can transform a tiny house into a truly livable sanctuary. FAQs 1. What makes the Sonoma tiny home different from other tiny houses? The Sonoma tiny home offers an excellent blend of spaciousness and smart design, which is uncommon in most compact dwellings. Unlike many tiny houses that feel cramped or utilitarian, the Sonoma offers a genuinely open living area with high ceilings and abundant natural light, thanks to its large windows and skylights. Its layout is carefully planned to maximize comfort, featuring a full-size kitchen equipped with modern appliances, a dedicated dining area, and a living room that can easily accommodate guests. The home comes fully furnished, with each piece selected to enhance both style and functionality. 2. How much does the Sonoma tiny home cost, and what’s included in the price? The Sonoma tiny home is priced at $110,000, which positions it as an accessible option in the modern tiny house market. This price includes a fully furnished interior, so buyers receive not just the structure itself but also all major furniture, built-in storage, and essential appliances. The package covers the living room’s L-shaped sofa bed, a complete kitchen setup with oven, cooktop, refrigerator, and even a washer/dryer, as well as a finished bathroom and a loft bedroom with a double bed. Essentially, the Sonoma is delivered move-in ready, allowing new owners to settle in immediately without the need for additional purchases or upgrades. 3. Can you customize the Sonoma tiny home’s interior or layout? Yes, the Sonoma tiny home offers a degree of customization to suit individual preferences and needs. Buyers can typically select from a range of finishes, materials, and color palettes to personalize the interior aesthetic. There may also be options to adjust certain features, such as cabinetry, fixtures, or storage solutions, depending on the manufacturer’s offerings. While the core layout is designed for optimal space and flow, Spindrift Homes aim to accommodate requests that help make each Sonoma feel unique and tailored to its owner’s lifestyle.
